threats.title: Employee discloses secrets
threats.description: An employee could  expose secrets to a naughty employee by accidentally putting them somewhere in the repository
threats.mitigation: Use a tool like git-secrets, which can detect secrets and block the changes to the repository

threats.title: Repository gets cloned without permission
threats.description: A naughty developer copies/clones the repository without permission, possibly revealing its contents  to the outside
threats.mitigation: Enable audit logging and monitoring of data access

threats.title: Someone spoofing the administrator
threats.description: Someone might spoof and pretend to be the administrator if they find access to the administrator's account
threats.mitigation: Make the administrator have multifactor authentication to log in, encrypt the laptop/computer in case it ever gets stolen

threats.title: Tampered dependency
threats.description: Someone could tamper with the repositories you are getting dependencies from, or make a malicious dependency a developer might use, not knowing it's harmful
threats.mitigation: Do an automated dependencies analysis, make a company policy that will check for approval of every dependency added

threats.title: Image with backdoor
threats.description: A naughty developer pushes an image containing a backdoor somewhere to the container, intending for that image to be pulled and deployed as a production image
threats.mitigation: Use image signing so only images that have been properly signed can be deployed, don't store development and production images on the same container and restrict access to the production container
